articles.title: Chongryon officials vow to greatly help build powerful nation
S. Korean chief executive's "New Year address"  under fire
articles.content:
Chongryon officials vow to greatly help build powerful nation
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) staying in the socialist homeland vowed to make tangible contributions to the building of a Juche-based powerful nation under the guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, in hearty response to the joint New Year editorial.
   Department director Song Kun Hak of the central standing committee of Chongryon said last year witnessed the full demonstration  of the national power of Juche Korea through the successful launch of the first artificial satellite into orbit, adding that he keenly felt the greatness of the country.
   He said he would greatly help build the Juche-based powerful nation, mindful that the unfailing loyalty to the guidance of the marshal, a great man born of heaven, leads to victory and glory.
   Vice-chairperson Pak Yong Mi of the central standing committee of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan expressed the conviction that as long as there are the great ideas, outstanding strategy and wise guidance of the Marshal, a new era of the building of a powerful and prosperous nation will be opened in the near future.
   Pak vowed to make great contributions to  the prosperity and development of the country, keeping pace with the people in the homeland who are making a new breakthrough in the building of a powerful nation, conduct a powerful national reunification movement with renewed confidence and courage, imbue the younger generation of compatriots with the soul of the nation and firmly unite them around the Marshal.

articles.title: Wails calling militaristic ghost
articles.content:
S. Korean chief executive's "New Year address"  under fire
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today comes out with a commentary criticising the South Korean chief executive for slandering North Korea in his "New Year address".
   From early in the year, he clamoured about somebody's "possible provocation" and cried that they would "utterly cope with" it in "cooperation" with U.S. and Japanese masters, the news analyst says, stressing his remarks mirror the criminal attempt to intensify the confrontation moves against the north.
  The commentary continues:
   If the South Korean chief executive had an iota of national conscience and reason,  in the "New Year address" he should not have let loose a string of tirade about the "year  of catastrophic crisis"  but should  have expressed his willingness to step down,  bearing responsibility for having brought about such bankruptcy. And he should have expressed his  intention to respond to the unanimous demand of the nation for replacing the anti-north confrontation policy by a pro-north reconciliation one. 
   But, without a single word of it, he reeled off a string of hokum such as "growth" and the "finishing of reform" and provocative words against North Korea. This is an unpardonable mockery of the South Korean people and an undisguised challenge to the north.
   The Korean people are keeping tabs on the crimes committed by the rulers of the "government for the people" against the country and the nation.

articles.title: Slogan calling for building powerful nation
articles.content:
Wails calling militaristic ghost
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today comes out with a signed commentary on sounds of wail which rang out at a "memorial service" held at a hall near the "Yasukuni Shrine" on December 23, last year.
   Branding them as wails calling ghosts of Japanese militarism, the news analyst of the paper says:
   On December 23, 50 years ago, special-class war criminal Hideki Tojo and other militarists of Japan were put to death by hanging after having been judged by history.
   At the memorial service sponsored by a Japanese rightwing organisation, its chief stated, "We should not say that this war was wrong and that war was right."
   His utterances mean that the bloody murderous war staged by Japan in the past was not "wrong". Indeed, his rigmarole is the height of shamelessness.
   What cannot be overlooked is the fact that although he said such nonsensical utterances, he is not in the least denounced or punished in Japan. This reality clearly proves that how widely the militaristic spirit is now spreading in Japan.
   The Japanese authorities are overtly and covertly trying to instil the militaristic idea into the minds of the Japanese people.
   Now, sounds of wail calling the militaristic ghost are daily ringing out aloud in Japan.
   This represents Japan's ulterior ambition for reinvasion.

articles.title: Fascist law to stifle "Jongyojo"
articles.content:
Slogan calling for building powerful nation
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- The joint New Year editorial set forth the slogan "Let this year mark a turning-point  in building a powerful nation ", which powerfully calls upon the Korean people to make a general onward march for the building of a powerful socialist nation.
   Reflected in this slogan is the steadfast will of the Workers' Party of Korea to build a powerful nation without fail.
   The slogan also carries the rockfirm will of the Korean people to bring about a great turn in following up the forced march with a cheerful advance this year and effect a new upswing in building a powerful nation by enlisting all the political, economic and military potentials.
   The Korean people have made an "arduous march" for several years, confronted with the imperialist allied forces. This march was not merely a defensive one but a bold offensive to win a greater victory in the revolution. In those days they successfully made a breakthrough in the forced march.
   It is now a decisive period  like the time when the Korean People's Revolutionary Army was advancing into the homeland after successfully concluding its arduous march in the grim period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
   It is the steadfast resolution and unshakable will of the WPK and the Korean people to  turn today's forced march into a cheerful advance without fail.
   Our rockfirm determination is to build a world-level powerful nation in the near future by bringing about economic revival this year through a second grand march of Chollima in socialist construction.
   This year, Korea is to shore up the coal, power and metal industries and railway transport and turn out better and more goods urgently necessary for the people's living. And a great change should be made in potato farming so as to decisively solve the food problem.
   Mirrored in the slogan is the stamina of the invincible Korean People's Army and people to bravely fight against any formidable enemy and win a victory at any cost.
   The Korean people have dynamically begun the New Year's march to brilliantly adorn this year as a great turning-point in building a powerful nation.

articles.title: Statement of spokesman for KPA general staff supported abroad
articles.content:
Fascist law to stifle "Jongyojo"
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- A plenary meeting of the Environment and Labor Committee of the National Assembly approved a "bill" on the establishment and operation of the Union of Teachers on December 29 last year, according to a radio report from Seoul. Synchronizing with this, the chief executive of South Korea said as the "bill" was deliberated on and approved by the relevant subcommittee of the "National Assembly," the "National Teachers Union" ("Jongyojo") will be legalised if the bill was deliberated on and approved by the "Legislation and Judiciary Committee of the National Assembly" and the plenary meeting of the "National Assembly."
   All this is a deception.
   The "bill" includes an article banning the right to strike, the kernel of the three rights of labor, and an article banning the establishment of grassroot bodies at schools and allowing the setting up of the central body of the "Jongyojo" alone.
   That trick aims to make "Jongyojo" a feeble organisation with no fighting capacity and with no ground.

articles.title: Resolution of Korean people
articles.content:
Statement of spokesman for KPA general staff supported abroad 
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Foreign political parties and organizations have released statements supporting the statement of the spokesman for the general staff of the Korean People's Army (KPA). 
   The executive committee of the Russian Party for Peace and Unity in a statement issued on Dec. 28 last year said that the U.S. administration  was responsible entirely for aggravation of the situation, considering  that the U.S. threat to the DPRK is a wanton violation of international laws and one more challenge to the world community.
   The statement called upon all peace-loving people to pool strength and deliver decisive counterblows to aggressors who encroach upon freedom and sovereignty of the DPRK.
   A joint statement was issued on December 22 last year by the socialist party, the federation of trade unions, the Kissan Committee and the  Organization for Afro-Asian People's Solidarity in Pakistan, the  lahore branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and the Pakistan Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification. 
   The statement said that the U.S. imperialists' "operation plan 5027" is a plan for a war of aggression to realize their fantastic daydream of occupying the DPRK and subordinating  the Korean people and that the plan goes against the trend of times of independence for peace and progress against subordination, domination, aggression and interference.
   The statement demanded that the U.S. imperialists learn a due lesson from their bitter defeat in the last Korean war and stop their move to unleash another Korean war of aggression at once.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on way of country's reunification
articles.content:
Resolution of Korean people
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- The joint new year editorial  indicates how to maintain a steady rate of production in all domains of the national economy, put the national economy  as a whole on its right track and stabilize and improve the people's living this year when a new turning-point  will be made in building a powerful nation.
   Upon receiving the joint editorial, the Korean working people  are making up their mind to achieve great success in the struggle to build an economically powerful socialist country.
   Kim Sung Hyon, vice-Minister of Metal and Machine-Building Industries, expressed his determination to increase the production of pig iron, rolled steel, machine tools and ordered equipment and  thus adorn the year of general advance with miracles and exploits and make a new breakthrough in building a powerful nation.
   Pang Chol Sun, manager of the Huichon General Machine Tool Plant, said that this year, too, they would make innovations in production of machine tools as during the post-war period when the great Chollima upsurge was made and actively contribute to the building of a powerful nation.
   Pak Hong Nam, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, vowed to push forward the construction of dwelling houses of the capital and major projects and hasten the construction of the Pyongyang-Nampho Express Highway.
   Agricultural workers renewed their determination to make a turning-point in agricultural production  vital to building a powerful nation.
   U Yong Sun, chairwoman of the Pongsan county, North Hwanghae Province, cooperative farm management committee, expressed her resolution to increase grain production by distributing crops on the principle of the right crop on right soil and in the proper  time and widely raising double crops a year and thus contribute to building a powerful nation.
   Pak Kun Su, managing director of the Taehongdan County Integrated Farm of Ryanggang Province, pointed out that he would turn the farm into a famous potato producer by making a turning point in potato-farming.

articles.title: Pyongyangites vow to let this year mark turning- point
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on way of country's reunification
   Pyongyang, January 4 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today calls for the entire nation to give an impetus to this year's grand march for reunification with new confidence and courage and make a turning-point in the country's reunification.
   The author of an article of the paper says:
   It is a vital requirement of the nation to end the political and military confrontation between the north and south which has existed for more than half a century and to achieve national reconciliation and unity. 
   The country is now placed under a touch-and-go situation owing to the anti-DPRK confrontation and war moves of the U.S. imperialists and the South Korean ruling quarters. The outside forces who do not want Korea to be reunified, are trying to fish in troubled waters, inciting the confrontation between the north and south.
   If the inter-Korean political and military confrontation continues under this situation,  domination and interference by outside forces can not be ended nor can peace be ensured but the nation will go to ruin. 
   South Korea should not depend on the outside forces but take the way for reunification through alliance with communism and the north, joining hands with the fellow countrymen in the north. 
   The five-point policy of the great unity of the nation put forth by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is a great banner and charter of the country's reunification. Since he leads the grand march  of the nation toward reunification,   the prospect of the country's reunification is bright.
